channel.title: nlin.SI updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: nlin.SI updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Generalized Riemann-Hilbert-Birkhoff Decomposition and a New Class of Higher Grading Integrable Hierarchies
item.description: arXiv:2507.10744v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We propose a generalized Riemann-Hilbert-Birkhoff decomposition that expands the standard integrable hierarchy formalism in two fundamental ways: it allows for integer powers of Lax matrix components in the flow equations to be increased as compared to conventional models, and it incorporates constant non-zero vacuum (background) solutions. Two additional parameters control these features. The first one defines the grade of a semisimple element that underpins the algebraic construction of the hierarchy, where a grade-one semi-simple element recovers known hierarchies such as mKdV and AKNS. The second parameter distinguishes between zero and non-zero constant background (vacuum) configurations. Additionally, we introduce a third parameter associated with an ambiguity in the definition of the grade-zero component of the dressing matrices. While not affecting the decomposition itself, this parameter classifies different gauge realizations of the integrable equations (like for example, Kaup-Newell, Gerdjikov-Ivanov, Chen-Lee-Liu models). For various values of these parameters, we construct and analyze corresponding integrable models in a unified universal manner demonstrating the broad applicability and generative power of the extended formalism.
item.dc:creator: H. Aratyn, C. P. Constantinidis, J. F. Gomes, T. C. Santiago, A. H. Zimerman

item.title: Stabilizer entropy in non-integrable quantum evolutions
item.description: arXiv:2412.10228v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Entanglement and stabilizer entropy are both involved in the onset of complex behavior in quantum many-body systems. Their interplay is at the root of complexity of simulability, scrambling, thermalization and typicality. In this work, we study the dynamics of entanglement, stabilizer entropy, and the anti-flatness of the entanglement spectrum after a quantum quench in a spin chain. We find that free-fermion theories show a gap in the long-time behavior of these resources compared to their random matrix theory value while non-integrable models saturate it.
item.dc:creator: Jovan Odavi\'c, Michele Viscardi, Alioscia Hamma
